newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei end at 1997 high as outlook improves.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei end at 1997 high as outlook improves.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended at a new 1997 high on Tuesday and dealers said the market looked set for further gains.
The lead Nikkei 225 June contract added 185 points to close at 20,550 after hitting a peak of 20,700. Its previous strongest close was on May 19 when it ended at 20,535.
Volume was higher than in recent days at 17,605 lots.
"There's been a change in sentiment as people feel the economy is improving. Yesterday's auto sales figure was quite good too," a trader at a European futures house said.
He said the June Nikkei could retrace down to the 20,300 level before heading higher.
"We should trade between 20,300 and 20,800 over the next few sessions," he added.
A chartist with a local institution said a weekly close above the 20,500 level would point to a bull run on the charts.
The June MSCI Taiwan index ended at 349.4 against its opening 348.1 on volume of 297 lots.
